page.title: 17ECOLOGY 4
page.content:
summer. The most numerous winter migrants are the geese some of which winter in this area though their destination is normally further south. Found,too, in this area are most species of British mammals with the fox being the most common. Other though rarer species are the badger, brown hare,pine martin, red squirrel, weasel and wild cat (including feral cats).
Wild life,ofany kind,is perhaps at less risk today than in the past for three reasons.Firstly the increasing costs of herdicides and insecticides has seen a decline in their use so plants and insects have a greater chance of survival. Secondly the closure of the Aluminium smelter which emitted fluoride gases which could affect the mineral intake of plants as
